{{cpp/chrono/month_day/title|ok}}
{{cpp/chrono/month_day/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|1=
constexpr bool ok() const noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}
Determines whether this {{tt|month_day}} stores a valid month-day combination.

The combination is valid if {{lc|month()}} represents a valid month ({{c|month().ok() {{==}} true}}), {{c|1=unsigned{day()} &gt;= 1}}, and {{c|1=unsigned{day()} &lt;= D}}, where D is the number of days in the month represented by {{tt|month()}}. The number of days in February is considered to be 29.

===Return value===
{{c|true}} if the month and day combination is valid, otherwise false.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha;

    constexpr auto md1{std::chrono::July/15};
    std::cout &lt;&lt; (md1.ok()) &lt;&lt; ' ';
    constexpr std::chrono::month_day md2{std::chrono::month(14), std::chrono::day(42)};
    std::cout &lt;&lt; (md2.ok()) &lt;&lt; ' ';
    constexpr auto md3{std::chrono::February/29};
    std::cout &lt;&lt; (md3.ok()) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
true false true
}}
